alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Harrison; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Taylor; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:34PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Randolph, Taylor, northeastern Upshur, Barbour and eastern Harrison Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 734 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grafton, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clarksburg, Elkins, Grafton, Philippi, Audra State Park, Bridgeport, Shinnston, Belington, Stonewood, Nutter Fort, Lumberport, Anmoore, Enterprise, Beverly, Junior, Lost Creek, Flemington, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Montrose and Valley Falls. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 111 and 128. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 78 and 82. Route 33 between mile markers 31 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northeastern West Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Barbour; Harrison; Northwest Randolph; Southeast Randolph; Taylor; Upshur
